answers.author: Amanda Thompson
answers.text:
Great article! I've found the greatest challenge in improvisation is the balance between responding to your creative impulses (playing the notes) while maintaing a critical eye to determine if what you are playing is new and effective. If you are just lost in the moment and purely responsive you lose the opportunity for repitition and refinement. It is so easy in our day to day jobs to see people and spaces as stuck with one fuction (e.g. a police officer only write tickets or this hall is just an entryway). What would we do differently if we opened our minds up to improvisation?
